title: Hospitality Management - How To Analyse and Maximise Your Restaurant's Profitability
headline: Learn the fundamental concepts of restaurant industry operations with this free online hospitality management course.
description: This free online hospitality management course teaches you how to successfully analyse and maximize your restaurant's profitability. You will learn that success in running a restaurant involves factors such as the ability to maximize seat occupancy and control beverage and food costs. Learn revenue and cost analysis skills essential in achieving the objectives of maximum profitability while still maintaining the quality of service and food.

courseDescription:
In this free online course, "Hospitality Management - Analyse and Maximize Your Restaurant's Profitability", you will learn that success in restaurant business management depends not only on your operational skills but also on how well you understand restaurant revenue and expenses. This video course focuses on teaching you the fundamentals of how to maximize profitability in the food and beverage (F&B) business.

The restaurant operations course begins by introducing you to the fundamentals of running a restaurant as a business and includes topics such as menu design principles, business planning, and how to segment and analyse restaurant revenue. You will also learn about obtaining the key restaurant metrics and how to compare these with competitors. The course also teaches you about the menu engineering report and strategies to maximize revenue and profitability.

The course is designed for Restaurant Managers / Assistant Managers so that they can successfully manage profitability in restaurants; Independent restaurant owners and managers who do not have formal business education; and Hotel Management students to give them some practical experience before starting their careers. So, start this free course today if you need to know valuable skills about how to analyse and maximize your restaurant's profitability.

Start Course Now

All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
topics: Analyse and Maximise Your Restaurant's Profitability - Course Assessment

slides:
• Upon Successful completion of this module you will be able to
    • Describe the F&B Operations
    • Explain positioning concepts of a new / established restaurant in a structured manner
    • Design a menu in compliance with best practices

  • Introduction to the course and F&B Operations

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Restaurant Positioning and Planning the Business

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Restaurant Positioning and Planning the Business

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understanding F&B Operations - Lesson Summary
  • In this Module we have learned that

    1. F&B Operations does not include only taking order, serving food and cleaning. it includes planning menu, defining concepts, identifying customers, managing customer loyalty as well.

    2. Restaurant Business Planning starts from understanding customer requirements and differentiating the value delivered compared to competitors. Guest / Customers need should be placed first and before everything in making concept design, menu design.

    3. Menu Design should follow best practices as per psychological studies on what attracts attention of guests such as,
    • Most important items should be on left top corner as most guest see that first.
    • Box can be used to emphasis items to be upsold.
    • Prices should be mentioned discretely.
    • Ingredients should be mentioned clearly so that guest can understand it easily
  • After successfully Completing this module you will be able to
    • Analyse F&B Revenue by meal period, average check and source of business.
    • Describe what are the area of improvement in revenue opportunities
    • Describe what is menu engineering report.
    • Able to explain best selling items in restaurant and take action for those which are not very profitable.
    • Describe major costs involves in operations and how to control it.

  • Let's Understand where the business is coming from

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Let's Understand where the business is coming from

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understand - Menu Engineering Concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understand - Menu Engineering Concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understand - Menu Engineering Concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understanding Overall Profitability and key cost concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understanding Overall Profitability and key cost concepts

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Restaurant Profitability & Analysis - Strategies and Method - Lesson Summary
  • We have learned in this module that.
    • It is very important to segment the revenue by meal period by source of guest and also revenue type so that we are able understand reasons of shortfall form budget / previous year performance and segmentation will allow us to understand cause of shortfall and also which areas, meal period we should focus upon to maximize revenue opportunities.
    • Once we have understood that shortfall from revenue, we need menu engineering report to further breakdown which type of food is popular and not popular. We can combine them with other popular items, do other promotions as we have learned in videos.
    • F&B Cost is also an important aspect of profitability which must be observed. Menu engineering report gives an overall food cost which should then be compared with actual cost. If actual cost is off by more than 5-10% from menu engineering report it must be analysed for wastage.
